result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin E Carson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen/DNA to the  State Crime Lab for testing.
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees out of bail on deposit if any.  Balance due in the way of a payment plan.  Defendant shall make payments of $30.00 per month commencing on 9/1/2016 until paid in full. Failure to miss any payments shall result in the balance of the fines due immediately.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.   TIME SERVED.

As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms at any time in the future.  941.29 Wis. stats makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it it's own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000.00 fine or both.  Possess weapon as a convicted felon 973.176(1).
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin E Carson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety. DZ
Bail Refund Packet
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) gj

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

THE COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 45 in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 45 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due in the way of a payment plan. Defendant shall make payments of $30.00 per month commencing on 09-01-2016 until paid in full. Failure to miss any payments shall result in the balance of the fines due IMMEDIATELY.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1).
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.


Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for Brandon A Wigley for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
16RM029982  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Dennis Patrick Murphy for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court addresses the Justice Point report.  Defense needs to obtain the file from previous counsel.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point dated 5-31-16 received and filed./ds

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant states he does want the public defender's office to represent him now.  Defendant has a VOP hold.  Defendant states he wishes to have a new attorney and does not want Attorney Sargent.  Court grants defense motion and removes Attorney Sargent from counsel of record.  Court sets bail at $1,000 cash TOT Justice Point with the following conditions:  1) no illegally controlled substances or alcohol; 2) random screening.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant returned on the bench warrant on 5-16-10.  Case set for return on warrant on 5-25-16 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.  Public defender's office notified./ds
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Benjamin E Carson not in court.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Sargent in court earlier.
Court stayed warrant until this afternoon.  Defendant did not show back up this afternoon.  Defendant failing to appear, and also non compliant with Justice Point, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  aw

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was here earlier, and left.  Defendant failing to appear when case was called, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until this afternoon.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed due to missed office contact.  aw

08/22/2014

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.  Justice Point Worker, Jazmynn, in court also.
Defendant's base test, tested positive for THC.  Court informs defendant that next court date needs to be negative.  Case remains set for plea and sentencing on 10/1/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  aw

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for ENHANCED Supervision.  Defendant to be drug tested.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Benjamin E Carson not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 10-1-2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant showed up today.  Attorney Sargent is in trial before Judge Seifert, and unable to appear.  Defendant has an open warrant and taken into custody.  Case adjourned for return on warrant on 8/21/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  aw
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Benjamin E Carson not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT.
VIOLATION REPORT, RECEIVED AND FILED.  

Defendant tested positive for THC, and then left before it could be addressed.  Court issues a warrant.  Next court date remains.  Clerk will inform attorney Sargent of today's appearance.  aw

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel is waiting for the probation agent to find a monitoring agency.  Court grants one final adjournment.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 8/20/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw
  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Benjamin E Carson not in court, in custody.  Stephan E Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests a plea date.  He still needs to talk with his client.  Defendant may be offered a DPA in this case.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 6/3/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen A Sargent in court, defendant Benjamin E Carson not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Stephan Nolten.
Defense counsel is trying to see if a DPA will be offered in this case.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/13/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court addresses violation report dated 4/7/2014, and 4/9/2014.  Court was advised defendant tested positive for THC, and then left Justice Point.  Defendant has now been taken into custody by the department of correction for a 45 day sanction for case 13CF4524.  This court takes no action.  Next court date remains set for an adjourned scheduling conference on 4/28/2014 at 8:30 am.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report, and follow up report received and filed.  aw

Court is in trial.  Defense counsel is trying to see if a DPA will be approved.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/28/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to continue with Justice Point.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw
Received and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Antonella Aleman, appearing for Stephan Nolten, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 3.

Court advises defendant to continue to cooperate with JusticePoint and all conditions of bail.
Clerk:  jms

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated March 13, 2014 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Benjamin E Carson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Benjamin E Carson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
